The only thing this really does is lower the skill ceiling of jungling, good junglers already knew how to track Red Blue buff spawn times even if they never saw it taken. 

Not much will change if this implemented.
This means that laners who don't pay much attention to timers will know exactly when buffs are up just from the map

I see it as a double edge sword, it's sort of like Kindred marks, you can use it to bait other team into trying to take it, then collapse in for the kill. 

I don't see laners looking to make an attempt to take it though honestly, it's extremely obvious when you leave lane to try and take the buffs, and once you do, that danger/missing ping goes down onto the buff and you'll be collapsed on.

Edit: I should clarify, I don't think laners will be looking to steal buffs more then they normally do. 

Although I will mention, the more I think about it, the more it will impact jungling even if you're not stealing other team's buff, it lets you know what side the other team's jungler starts, it lets you know where the jungler is pretty much every 5 minutes which I'm not crazy about, knowledge is power when you're jungling and this makes it a lot easier to obtain that knowledge.

Yes this will give us perfect information on the enemy jungler

Yeah buddy GREAT IDEA (Sarcasm). Sorry but who thought it was a good idea to let everyone know the route a jungler takes? That takes away from a large part of strat...

You don't seem to inderstand how it works...

Once a buff (Blue, Red, Drake, Herald, Nashor) will be at less than 60 second to respawn, it will have a white hourglass to show it and at less than 20 second, it will be a yellow one.

BUT if you didn't check the state of the buff beforehand, you won't have his total timer, nor will the camp be marked as empty on the minimap.

actaully, even if you didn't check the state of the buff the hourglass will come up at the 60 seconds; that's the part I disagree with fully, and I still disagree with the timer showing up at all for blue/red.

As I see it, you should be punished for not checking what route the jungler is taking by never getting that information for when you can actually try to force a fight or start to position for one, you shouldn't get free information that makes it so junglers like Amumu have absolutely no chance to take any buffs besides MAYBE their first clear if the enemy jungler is so inclined.
Much like with the change to dragon, it doesn't really make sense.  Having to estimate or track spawn timers has always been a fundamental part of the game.
